profile_positions.description:
In-charge 40% spending and 89% saving with direct reports of 3 team members (Category: Media & CRM & Research & PR & External Affairs for Total Company / ATL & BTL for Cognac Business Unit).

Award: 2020 CIIE Business Critical Project Award, 2021 Sustainability Innovation Awards, 2022 Make a Difference Award for Pernod Ricard China Preferred Supplier Program, and 2022 Breakthrough Award for E-Library Digital Transformation.

1. Procurement leadership role of Cognac BU, Media & Research, Public Relations & External Affairs, and South China Region for all marketing spending. 

2. Procurement leadership role of Media Efficiency & Effectiveness Enhancement project to build a virtuous media ecosystem and roadmap to be in-line with group golden rule and to leverage data intelligence to deliver Data & Media approach for central projects. Finally, to design & build quantify and measurable efficiency gain and loss, and qualitative and quantitative of 29.2% media net cost optimization (total media investment optimization including media net price, renumeration and annual volume rebate is 8%).

3. Procurement leadership role to A-Z establish the pilot of Pernod Ricard China Preferred Supplier Management as 2021 key procurement transformation project along with 37% supplier pool optimization and 10% cost optimization along with solid process and playbook to drive sustainable result. 

4. Procurement leadership role to A-Z build internal control of on-site check for media OOH, event and image outlet categories as supplier performance evaluation until payment.

5. Procurement leadership role to lead Cognac BU as pilot to optimize ATL & BTL category rate cards with 8-10% cost optimization.

profile_positions.description: At APAC zone level, in charge of APAC Purchasing Excellence, including Internal Audit for the process and guideline of supplier portfolio, referencing and review; request for quotation; and saving & reporting. In addition, all sustainability topics of - Sharing Beauty with All. Furthermore, MyMarket project (Request to Pay) and relevant BI reporting for strategic purchasing strategy.
profile_positions.title: APAC Purchasing Excellence Manager

profile_positions.description:
1. To be the group pilot country in rolling out REQUEST TO PAY, MyMarket, project in Greater China and as the PURCHASING LEAD in APAC. It is a multi-national project with APAC, Europe and Americas and a cross-function project with finance, purchasing and IT. The total scope of project including 4 zones, 36 countries, 80000 suppliers and 15000 employees. At the same time rolling out the project in APAC, continuously supported Americas in preparation and implementation.

2. The main role and responsibility is to lead all APAC country purchasing teams (both Sourcing & Business Partner Teams) to enhance purchasing maturity, including purchasing organization, purchasing content (contract, ratecard and catalog) and preferred supplier list; in addition, to optimize end-to-end purchasing process from request to invoice. Furthermore, along the project, to design and implement internal and external communication and change management strategy to stakeholders and suppliers. Finally, to strategically analyze the purchasing report and define future purchasing strategy.
profile_positions.title: Purchasing Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
1. To be the APAC representative, base in Paris, for the group project which highly focused on purchasing and finance referential, purchasing content, efficiency and digitalization: Request to Pay - MyMarket. The technologies from end to end include SAP SRM, Ariba Catalog, Ariba Price Request, Microsoft BI Report and Sharepoint to ensure the high efficiency and digitalization of the internal and external process with stakeholder and supplier. The total scope of project including 4 zones, 36 countries, 80000 suppliers and 15000 employees.

2. It is a multi-national project with APAC, Europe and Americas and a cross-function project with finance, purchasing and IT. To be the LEADERSHIP ROLE of PROJECT MANAGEMENT to design and build Buying Portal, end-to end Purchase Request to Invoice, and to contribute in Group Purchasing Classification and Online Brief to Price Request streams with the focus of process, functionalities and user experience. Finally, the communication and change management for all topics above for stakeholders and suppliers.
profile_positions.title: Purchasing Business Expert

profile_positions.description:
A - Purchasing Compliance
To be in accordance with group guidance and internal control on end-to-end purchasing process, supplier referencing and registration and contracting process. In 2015, launched the first purchasing card project in Taiwan to manage MICE category focused on: Smart Buy, Easy Buy, A Better Buy vision to optimize the category, digitalize the process and in compliance with the end to end process from request to payment. The project was the pilot in APAC and won the 2017 internal control award of simplification and process efficiency category. 


B - Purchasing Performance
1.	Economical Purchasing Saving
2.	Efficient Performance for Procurement Activity and focus on “In Time to Market”

C – Purchasing Content
1.	Responsible categories include IT&T, Facility, Public Relations, MICE (Meeting/Incentive/Conference/Event), HR Services, Professional Services (Legal/Audit), General Supplies, Packaging Material, Property Rent, and Logistics…etc.
2.	The main role and responsibility includes the end-to-end sourcing, supplier referencing for preferred supplier list from group standards on quality, supply chain & service, innovation, CSR & sustainability, and competitiveness. In addition, contract, ratecard & catalog, supplier management, business request analysis and supply analysis. Furthermore, the reporting to focus on driving strategy and ensuring risk management; finally, the operational cases to follow the actual order and quality follow up for ad-hoc cases.
